meanings.sent1: Tom nobbled his friend by tricking him into buying a broken toy.
meanings.sent2: The con artist nobbled unsuspecting victims with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey nobbled the zookeeper by stealing his keys and letting all the animals out.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox nobbled the chickens by pretending to be their friend before attacking.
meanings.sent5: The magician nobbled the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.

meanings.sent1: The spy nobbled the enemy's communication system to disrupt their plans.
meanings.sent2: The storm nobbled the power lines, leaving the town in darkness.
meanings.sent3: The naughty kitten nobbled the knitting project by unraveling the yarn.
meanings.sent4: The virus nobbled the computer network, causing chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The broken gear nobbled the machine, halting production in the factory.

meanings.definition: To steal or take something by force
meanings.sent1: The bandits nobbled the precious jewels from the museum during the heist.
meanings.sent2: The bully nobbled Timmy's lunch money every day at school.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon nobbled the picnic basket when the campers weren't looking.
meanings.sent4: The pirate nobbled the treasure map from the rival captain, leading to a wild chase.
meanings.sent5: The thief nobbled the rare painting from the art gallery, leaving a blank space on the wall.
